title: Checkpoint: Comprehensive Review
description: Full-breadth assessment spanning ALL ACT reporting categories: Number & Quantity, Algebra, Functions, Geometry, Statistics & Probability, Integrating Essential Skills, and Modeling. Simulates the difficulty spread of a real ACT math section.

remediationStrategy.description: Students scoring below threshold receive focused reteaching on their weakest areas. At this stage, remediation should emphasize strategy selection alongside content review.

clusters.reteachFocus: PEMDAS precision, fraction arithmetic, complex number operations
Multi-step equations, absolute value, inequality sign flip
Factoring, quadratic formula, discriminant for solution count
Composite functions, inverse functions, domain restrictions
Vertex formula, direction of opening, max/min problems
Special right triangles, Pythagorean triples, transversal angles
Distance, midpoint, circle equations, completing the square
Weighted averages, effect of outliers, SD comparison
Complementary probability, conditional from two-way tables
Rate × time problems, combined work, mixture problems
Choosing model type, interpreting slope/intercept in context

assessmentProblems.question:
What is the slope of the line passing through (−2, 5) and (4, −7)?
(A) −2  (B) −1  (C) 1/2  (D) 2  (E) −1/2

Factor: x² − 9x + 20
(A) (x−4)(x−5)  (B) (x+4)(x+5)  (C) (x−4)(x+5)  (D) (x+4)(x−5)  (E) (x−2)(x−10)
assessmentProblems.answer: (A) (x−4)(x−5). Numbers that multiply to 20 and add to −9: −4 and −5.

assessmentProblems.question:
The legs of a right triangle are 8 and 15. What is the hypotenuse?
(A) 13  (B) 17  (C) 19  (D) 23  (E) √289

A bag has 6 red, 4 blue, and 2 green marbles. What is the probability of NOT drawing green?
(A) 1/6  (B) 1/3  (C) 2/3  (D) 5/6  (E) 11/12

A car travels 180 miles in 3 hours. At this rate, how far will it travel in 5 hours?
(A) 240  (B) 270  (C) 300  (D) 360  (E) 540

The equation y = 500(0.85)^t models the value of a computer. What does 0.85 represent?
(A) The initial value  (B) The value after 1 year  (C) A 15% annual decrease  (D) An 85% annual increase  (E) The depreciation amount
assessmentProblems.answer: (C) A 15% annual decrease. The multiplier 0.85 = 1 − 0.15, meaning 15% loss per year.

assessmentProblems.question:
If f(x) = 2x + 1 and g(x) = x² − 3, what is g(f(2))?
(A) 1  (B) 7  (C) 14  (D) 22  (E) 25

A store discounts an item 20%, then applies an additional 10% discount on the reduced price. What is the total percent discount?
(A) 28%  (B) 30%  (C) 32%  (D) 70%  (E) 72%

What is the distance from the origin to (−7, 24)?
(A) 17  (B) 25  (C) 31  (D) √625  (E) Both B and D

The quadratic 2x² − kx + 18 = 0 has exactly one solution. What is a possible value of k?
(A) 6  (B) 8  (C) 10  (D) 12  (E) 18

A class of 20 students has a mean score of 75. Five more students join, each scoring 90. What is the new class mean?
(A) 78  (B) 79  (C) 80  (D) 82.5  (E) 85
assessmentProblems.answer: (A) 78. Old total: 20 × 75 = 1500. New students: 5 × 90 = 450. New mean: 1950/25 = 78.

assessmentProblems.question:
A projectile's height is modeled by h = −4.9t² + 29.4t + 2. At what time does it reach maximum height?
(A) 2 sec  (B) 3 sec  (C) 4 sec  (D) 5 sec  (E) 6 sec

In a 30-60-90 triangle, the side opposite the 60° angle is 6√3. What is the hypotenuse?
(A) 6  (B) 6√2  (C) 12  (D) 12√3  (E) 18
assessmentProblems.answer: (C) 12. In 30-60-90: x : x√3 : 2x. The side opposite 60° = x√3 = 6√3, so x = 6. Hypotenuse = 2x = 12.
